definition: to be shoulder to shoulder/to be on an equal level with/Taiwan pr. [bi4 jian1]
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
shoulder/to shoulder (responsibilities etc)

sentences.english: I don’t think I equal him on either dimension.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得我在兩方面都無法和他比肩。

sentences.english: Forged in a fire lit long ago, stand next to me, you'll never stand i moreovertself.
sentences.chinese: 歷煉之火早已燃起，與我比肩，你將永不寂寞。

sentences.english: Few foods can hold a candle to this leafy green.
sentences.chinese: 少有蔬菜能與這種多葉綠色植物比肩。

sentences.english: Ultimately, it is the Israelis and the Palestinians who must live side by side.
sentences.chinese: 歸根結底，以色列人和巴勒斯坦人必須比肩而居。

sentences.english: The Temple Fair is busy and crowded today.
sentences.chinese: 廟會上人們比肩繼踵，真是熱鬧啊。

sentences.english: His footwork and mid-range game may be the best ever next to Jordan.
sentences.chinese: 出色的步法和中投，可以和喬丹比肩。

sentences.english: Her shoulder-length, ash-blond hair was fastened with a clip at the back of her neck.
sentences.chinese: 一頭灰金色比肩長的頭髮用小發卡攏在脖頸後。

definition: to be equal to/to be well-matched/rival
to discuss two disparate things together (idiom); to mention on equal terms/to place on a par with/(often with negatives: impossible to mention X in the same breath as Y)
to match/is comparable with
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
contend against
to be on an equal footing
to surpass/to exceed/to transcend
to hope to reach/to strive for
can be counted on one's fingers (idiom)/very few
equally matched/about the same
to overtake
to turn up one's nose/to show disdain for/to regard superciliously
top quality/front ranking
equally famous
to compare/to draw a parallel/to match/analogy/metaphor/comparison
summit/apex/pinnacle (of one's career etc)/peak (of a civilization etc)
